cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles W of the Dry Tortugas
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward the northern Gulf Coast (AL/FL Panhandle)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the AL/FL border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama/Florida border eastward to Ochlockonee River, FL (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet – possible later for same stretch of northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward through the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Little to no tropical-storm-force wind is expected at Toledo-Lucas County Port, OH
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; the port is inland on Lake Erie
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could produce light to moderate rain (generally <2 inches) late this week as the system’s remnants move northeastward into the Ohio Valley
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized ponding on docks or access roads possible if remnant rains coincide with existing drainage issues; otherwise none
